intro: Platystele cuculligera, commonly known as the hooded ghost plant, is a rare and unique member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial bromeliad characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves that form a water-holding cup. Native to the cloud forests of Central and South America, this plant thrives in high humidity and shade. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically emerging from the center of the leaf rosette. Due to its specialized habitat requirements, Platystele cuculligera is considered endangered and is often found in conservation programs.
